#Text=3. Approach
#Text=The purpose of this study was to identify the power consumption of buildings and determine the variables that contribute to their use .
#Text=This study confirms that key variables obtained using clustering in machine learning strongly correlate with the energy consumption of buildings .
#Text=For this purpose , it is important to first identify building energy consumption patterns .
#Text=This was done based on a total of 16 variables related to building energy usage , in addition to the electricity consumption of the target building .
#Text=Then , the variables that best define the energy consumption patterns were identified .
#Text=The major elements affecting consumption are not identified by simulation , or by the analyst ’s experience , but through a machine learning process .
#Text=The structure of the research work is described below and
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=shows simplify the process of this study from the number one to six .
#Text=( 1 )
#Text=This study targets 11 office buildings in eight different regions of South Korea .
#Text=Their heating and cooling systems use electricity .
#Text=The 11 buildings all have different areas , building designs , and heating and cooling systems , and are used for different purposes .
#Text=In the data analysis , the physical qualities are referred to as nominal variables .
#Text=In this study , only the continuous data that change in real time as a result of the actions of the occupants were used for the analysis .

#Text=Four categories of variables were identified for the analysis , i. e. , the amount of electric energy used by the building , external environmental data , building system data , and occupancy schedules .
#Text=In total , 16 continuous variables were selected ;

#Text=( 2 ) Before analyzing the large amount of data used in machine learning , preprocessing is a necessary step that prepares data by processing missing values , removing noise , or removing outliers .
#Text=In data preprocessing , cleaning is a process that fills in or removes missing values , corrects noisy data , identifies outliers , and therefore ensures the consistency of data outcomes ;

#Text=( 3 ) The data set in this research contains time variables ( such as the year , month , day , day of the week , and hour ) , external environment variables ( including temperature , humidity , sunlight , airflow , wind speed , and soil temperature ) , and energy variables that track the energy consumed during the building operating hours ( in 2016 , use of electricity consumption hourly data of 11 offices ) ;
#Text=( 4 ) To determine the most important variables , unsupervised learning , which does not require a ground truth , was used .
#Text=This involved using clustering to extract the most important variables that control the building energy usage and cluster similar variables together ;
#Text=( 5 ) In addition , using the t -test , we aimed to verify the validity of the variables , derived from machine learning , that affect the building energy consumption ;
#Text=( 6 ) For each target building , the first 16 variables related to energy consumption , and five variables derived from machine learning , were compared with the same verification logic .
#Text=As stated in Section 3 , this study aims to use energy data derived from a building and identify important variables that control most of the energy consumption .
#Text=Two representative clustering methodologies used for this purpose are the Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise ( DBSCAN ) and K-means .
#Text=3.1 .
#Text=Clustering : DBSCAN and K-Means
#Text=Density-based spatial clustering of applications with noise , one of the most widely used density-based clustering methods , explores core objects that have a high density in a neighborhood .
#Text=Centroid-based clustering methods of K-means predetermine the K value and the number of clusters , and then assign each datum to one of the K clusters to minimize dispersion .
#Text=Centroid-based algorithms have the advantages of clustering many data points quickly and easily , and spherical data have a relatively better reliability .
#Text=Table 4 shows a sequential list of operations performed through DBSCAN and K-means using the open-source program R 3.6.1 .

#Text=To summarize the clustering process for extracting key variables , first , similar characteristics ( density center , distance-based ) in the various data were assessed to create the first cluster .
#Text=Although N clusters were formed , it was impossible to determine which clusters were meaningful .
#Text=Then , results were extracted only for clusters containing a large amount of data .
#Text=Based on these results , the data were classified into high-energy-consumption and low-energy-consumption data clusters .
#Text=Lastly , for the two clusters with large amounts of high-energy-consumption data , box plots were used to confirm which of the 16 variables related to building energy were the most important .
